docs.title: ThermalNetwork Documentation
docs.text:
A library for sizing multiple ground heat exchangers distributed around a single-pipe thermal network.

The primary entry point is through the CLI, intended to be used with URBANopt. In the course of a typical UO workflow, sizing a Ground-source Heat Pump (GHP) is done with this command.

It is possible to access the CLI directly. Once this package has been installed successfully, the available commands may be seen with thermalnetwork --help.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text:
• System parameters file defining the network
    • Including GHE parameters
  • Folder of OpenStudio building loads for the network to supply
  • Geojson file describing the features (buildings, borefields, connectors, etc) and their locations

See the usage page for an example

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: ThermalNetwork is intended to be used via URBANopt. From within the URBANopt CLI, ThermalNetwork is one of the Python packages that is installed via the uo install_python command. Once that has been done, uo ghe_size becomes available as seen in the usage page.

docs.title: Developer installation
docs.text: ThermalNetwork can be installed by cloning the repository (GitHub link at top) and following the developer installation instructions.

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: ThermalNetwork updates values in a system parameters file by using GHEDesigner to properly size the boreholes for the loads described in the inputs.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
The expected usage of this package is via URBANopt. An example command from URBANopt is:

uo ghe_size --sys-param <path/to/sys_param.json> --feature <path/to/FEATUREFILE.json> --scenario <path/to/SCENARIOFILE.csv>

Full documnentation of the URBANopt commands to work with a Ground Heat Exchanger (GHE) can be found in the URBANopt documentation.

It is possible to use ThermalNetwork directly, and can be done so with a similar (though not identical) command:

thermalnetwork --system-parameter-file <path/to/sys_param.json> --geojson-file <path/to/FEATUREFILE.json> --scenario-directory <path/to/SCENARIO_dir>
